intro: Thliphthisa serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering thliphthis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, with a yellowish color, and bloom in late summer or autumn. Thliphthisa serotina is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants in its native habitat.
